This is the first round of a public goods game. Contributing to the pool benefits everyone since contributions are multiplied by 1.6 before being split. If all players contribute optimally, we each get back 1.6 * (our contribution) / 4 = 0.4 * our contribution, plus 0.4 times others' total contributions. However, there's an incentive to free-ride. I'll start with a moderate contribution of 6 to signal cooperation while protecting myself from total exploitation. This allows me to keep 4 points while still contributing meaningfully to test others' cooperation levels.

This is a classic public goods game. If everyone contributes their full 10 points, the pool would be 40 points, multiplied by 1.6 gives 64 points, split 4 ways = 16 points each. This is better than keeping 10 points individually. However, there's always the temptation to free-ride. For the first round, I'll contribute a moderate amount (7 points) to signal cooperation while keeping some points as insurance in case others don't cooperate. This allows me to test the waters and see how cooperative the other players are.
